snippet: The National Front party is finding support in parts of France’s post-industrial north where financial issues are proving more important than immigration.
abstract: France's National Front party, headed by Marine Le Pen, is finding support in the country's post-industrial north, where many residents who once voted Communist have embraced the far-right party's patriotic emphasis on French jobs, French nationalism and French money; growing popularity has President Nicolas Sarkozy worried that Le Pen may eliminate him in the first round of voting in April 2012.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The National Front party is finding support in parts of France’s post-industrial north where financial issues are proving more important than immigration.

headline.seo: With Focus on Economy, National Front Makes Gains in Northern France
headline.main: Focus on French Economy Fuels Gains by Far Right
headline.print_headline: Focus on French Economy Fuels Gains by Far Right
